label: A3B_oC32_64_def_d-001
title: R$_{2}$ Au$_{3}$Zn Structure
comments:
Au$_{3}$Zn is known to exist in three forms, depending upon the exact composition and temperature (Hisatsune, 1998): \begin{itemize} \item The \href{current_web_home_dir/A3B_tI64_142_def_d-001}{tetragonal $R_{1}$ phase} is stable below $\approx 475$K with a composition very nearly stoichiometric. \item The \href{current_web_home_dir/A3B_oC32_64_def_d-001}{orthorhombic $R_{2}$ phase} (this structure) is stable below $\approx 550$K with a composition range somewhat wider than the $R_{1}$ phase. \item The tetragonal $H$ phase has the \href{current_web_home_dir/A3B_tI16_139_cde_e-001}{$D0_{23}$ structure} and is stable at temperatures up to $\approx 700$K over a considerably wider range of stoichiometries than either the $R_{1}$ or $R_{2}$ phases. \end{itemize} ~ \vspace{-.25in} 
 (Iwaskai, 1962) gave structure of the $R_{2}$ phase in the $Abam$ of space group \#64.  We used FINDSYM to transform this to the $Cmca$ setting. 
 (Iwaskai, 1962) gave the lattice constants in kX units.  We used the conversion factor 1 kX = 1.00202{\AA}. (Wood, 1947) 
 We use the orthorhombic lattice constants from (Wilkens, 1958) rather than the pseudo-tetragonal lattice constants of (Iwaskai, 1962).
